title: Alaskan Catch of BC Salmon
text:
Information on Alaskan exploitation of Skeena sockeye comes primarily from the Northern Boundary Sockeye Run Reconstruction model, which uses estimated run-timing and migration route to provide estimates of interception rates in Alaska fisheries. We show timeseries of Alaskan exploitation rates for each Skeena sockeye Conservation Unit with information (Figure 1) and the distribution of exploitation rates (Figure 2).








Figure 1: Alaskan exploitation rates for each Skeena sockeye Conservation Unit (1960-2023).













Figure 2: Distribution of Alaskan exploitation rates on each Skeena sockeye CU with information (1960-2023).

Figure 3: Alaskan exploitation on Nass sockeye by CU.

title: Alaskan Catch of BC Salmon
text:
Skeena

Summary

Alaskan fisheries catch all species of salmon in the Skeena
Catch of Skeena sockeye is estimated through the Northern Boundary Run Reconstruction Model and can be very high in some years, especially on late timed populations



Sockeye
Information on Alaskan exploitation of Skeena sockeye comes primarily from the Northern Boundary Sockeye Run Reconstruction model, which uses estimated run-timing and migration route to provide estimates of interception rates in Alaska fisheries. We show timeseries of Alaskan exploitation rates for each Skeena sockeye Conservation Unit with information (Figure 1) and the distribution of exploitation rates (Figure 2).








Figure 1: Alaskan exploitation rates for each Skeena sockeye Conservation Unit (1960-2023).













Figure 2: Distribution of Alaskan exploitation rates on each Skeena sockeye CU with information (1960-2023).
